page.title: 15Guru Nanaksar Sikh Temple.
page.content: At the Puran Masih (Full Moon) it is our custom to celebrate Guru Nanak's birthday. People from all over the British Isles come to Coventry every month.The Guru Granth, the Holy Book, is read for 2 and a half days. When it is finished there are prayers and songs.Fresh, colourful flowers are thrown over the Granth together with many colourful cloths.Then Baba Ji, the High Priest,sits on the platform.He preaches and tells stories from the Granth.You listen carefully and you can always find a meaning for yourself.You think if you are living a good life and how you can improve to be nearer to God.We thank God,ask Him to bless the food,we pray then we go to the dining room to eat, meet our friends and talk in our language, Punjabi.
